paragraphs.content: Psalm 132
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 132

paragraphs.content: A Song of degrees.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A Song of degrees.

paragraphs.content: LORD, remember David, and all his afflictions:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lord, remember David, and all his afflictions:

paragraphs.content: How he sware unto the LORD, and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;
paragraphs.contentHtml: How he sware unto the Lord, and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;

paragraphs.content: Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;

paragraphs.content: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, or slumber to mine eyelids,
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, or slumber to mine eyelids,

paragraphs.content: Until I find out a place for the LORD, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Until I find out a place for the Lord, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.

paragraphs.content: Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.

paragraphs.content: We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.
paragraphs.contentHtml: We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.

paragraphs.content: Arise, O LORD, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Arise, O Lord, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.

paragraphs.content: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.

paragraphs.content: For thy servant David’s sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thy servant David’s sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.

paragraphs.content: The LORD hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.

paragraphs.content: If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.

paragraphs.content: For the LORD hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the Lord hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.

paragraphs.content: This is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.

paragraphs.content: I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.

paragraphs.content: I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

paragraphs.content: There will I make the horn of David to bud: I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There will I make the horn of David to bud: I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.

paragraphs.content: His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.
